tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
God... has power to make our resistance go up in flames
He puts redemption into our blanket

tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: the God who terrifies is also the one who loves us for all eternity

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the Exile, the Addict)
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are deep in sin
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit

revealed his conquering love in Jesus Christ

the price of sin... and every form of human wickedness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that requires God's 'conquering love' and 'irruption' to overcome; it is not a mere mistake but a state of being 'lost'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of following and service (Ethics).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter, Gideon, the Church)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical response ('they left everything and followed him') only occurs after the primary program of God's epiphany and 'Fear not' word is complete.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

voorbeelden: Grant that all... may keep the covenant
We can understand and even admire the hope
the awareness of sin comes only to those who are already standing on the firm ground
power to make our resistance go up in flames
sphere of power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to save those who lack the 'Pouvoir' to save themselves. It is a theology of enablement rather than obligation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Terror of God's presence) to S1 (Grace) by showing that S2 is the necessary precursor to S1, mediated by the 'Fear Not' of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking the S2 (Judgment/Death) upon Himself in the cross, allowing the Receiver to move from Sin to Grace.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the preacher insists that God is 'opposed to us' in our sin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor in every narrative arc. Human action is consistently portrayed as a reaction to God's prior 'irruption'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; the preacher explicitly deconstructs their 'valor' or 'merit'.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He puts redemption into our blanket.
He does not ask us what we are doing to make ourselves better; he just gives the gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'Receivers' of grace, not 'Models' of behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The preacher explicitly states Gideon is a 'nonentity' and Peter is 'sinful', shifting focus to God's patience and power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-improvement.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'terror' of the Law/Presence to the 'comfort' of the Gospel is perfectly maintained.
spanning_punten: The paradox of God being 'opposed to us' yet 'for us'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all... paying in his own body the price

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit/Word provides the 'enabling' (Pouvoir) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'addiction' and 'rebelliousness' that leads to being 'lost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's invasion of human space. The human Subject is consistently displaced by the Divine Subject.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic 'Grace' sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent (Sin) is already portrayed as lethal.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace'. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and keeps the focus entirely on the Divine Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'funny' Gideon story, semiotics reveals that Gideon's lack of 'valor' is a functional necessity for God to be the sole Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; semiotics shows how the 'Exile' functions as a state of 'Lack' that only a 'Sender' (God) can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'blanket' metaphor is a perfect representation of the Receiver actant—passive and dependent.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses 'fear' not as a moral requirement but as a semiotic marker of the encounter between the Finite and the Infinite.
